blockquote.p: code: Males and postmenopausal females at least 50 years of age.

code: Diagnosis of probable AD as defined by National Institute of Neurological and Communicative Disorders and Stroke (NINCDS) and the Alzheimer’s Disease and Related Disorders Association (ADRDA) guidelines
code: Hachinski Ischemic Scale score of ≤4
code: CNS imaging (CT scan or MRI of brain) compatible with AD within past 1 year.
code: Investigator has obtained informed consent signed by the patient (and/or legal representative) and by the caregiver.
code: Geographic proximity to investigator’s site that allows adequate follow-up.

code: A reliable caregiver who is in frequent or daily contact with the patient and who will accompany the patient to the office and/or be available by telephone at designated times, will monitor administration of prescribed medications, and will be responsible for the overall care of the patient at home. The caregiver and the patient must be able to communicate in English and willing to comply with 26 weeks of transdermal therapy.

text.value: Males and postmenopausal females at least 50 years of age.

Diagnosis of probable AD as defined by National Institute of Neurological and Communicative Disorders and Stroke (NINCDS) and the Alzheimer’s Disease and Related Disorders Association (ADRDA) guidelines
MMSE score of 10 to 23.
Hachinski Ischemic Scale score of ≤4
CNS imaging (CT scan or MRI of brain) compatible with AD within past 1 year.
Investigator has obtained informed consent signed by the patient (and/or legal representative) and by the caregiver.
Geographic proximity to investigator’s site that allows adequate follow-up.

A reliable caregiver who is in frequent or daily contact with the patient and who will accompany the patient to the office and/or be available by telephone at designated times, will monitor administration of prescribed medications, and will be responsible for the overall care of the patient at home. The caregiver and the patient must be able to communicate in English and willing to comply with 26 weeks of transdermal therapy.

blockquote.p: code: Persons who have previously completed or withdrawn from this study or any other study investigating xanomeline TTS or the oral formulation of xanomeline.
code: Use of any investigational agent or approved Alzheimer’s therapeutic medication within 30 days prior to enrollment into the study.
code: Serious illness which required hospitalization within 3 months of screening.
code: Stroke or vascular dementia documented by clinical history and/or radiographic findings interpretable by the investigator as indicative of these disorders
code: Seizure disorder other than simple childhood febrile seizures
code: Severe head trauma resulting in protracted loss of consciousness within the last 5 years, or multiple episodes of head trauma
code: Episode of depression meeting DSM-IV criteria within 3 months of screening.
code: A history within the last 5 years of Schizophrenia.
code: A history within the last 5 years of Bipolar Disease.
code: A history within the last 5 years of Ethanol or psychoactive drug abuse or dependence.
code: A history of syncope within the last 5 years.
code: Evidence from ECG recording of Left bundle branch block.
code: Evidence from ECG recording of Bradycardia ≤50 beats per minute
code: Evidence from ECG recording of Sinus pauses >2 seconds
code: Evidence from ECG recording of Second or third degree heart block unless treated with a pacemaker
code: Evidence from ECG recording of Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome
code: Evidence from ECG recording of Sustained supraventricular tachyarrhythmia including SVT≥10 sec, atrial fibrillation, atrial flutter.
code: Evidence from ECG recording of Ventricular tachycardia at a rate of ≥120 beats per minute lasting ≥10 seconds.
code: A history within the last 5 years of Clinically significant arrhythmia
code: A history within the last 5 years of Symptomatic sick sinus syndrome not treated with a pacemaker
code: A history within the last 5 years of Congestive heart failure refractory to treatment
code: A history within the last 5 years of Angina except angina controlled with PRN nitroglycerin
code: A history within the last 5 years of Resting heart rate <50 or >100 beats per minute, on physical exam
code: A history within the last 5 years of Uncontrolled hypertension.
code: A history within the last 5 years of a serious gastrointestinal disorder

div.p: identifier: id: H2Q-MC-LZZT (USUAL), id: NCTA12313212 (OFFICIAL), PLAC: NCTA12313212 (SECONDARY), PUBCHEM: 60809
title: Safety and Efficacy of the Xanomeline Transdermal Therapeutic System (TTS) in Patients with Mild to Moderate Alzheimer’s Disease
category: Interventional Study, Randomized Clinical Trial, Double Blind Study, Placebo Control, Parallel Study
focus: Xanomeline, Transdermal Patch Dosage Form, Effects of xanomeline, a selective muscarinic receptor agonist, on cognitive function and behavioral symptoms in Alzheimer disease
keyword: Selective M1 muscarinic agonists, Alzheimer Disease, Selective M1 muscarinic agonists
description: ## Xanomeline (LY246708) ### Protocol H2Q-MC-LZZT(c) Safety and Efficacy of the Xanomeline Transdermal Therapeutic System (TTS) in Patients with Mild to Moderate Alzheimer’s Disease
sponsor: Generated Summary: id: Eli Lilly and Company (OFFICIAL); crs
principalInvestigator: Generated Summary: UPIN: ABC123 (OFFICIAL); active; Samuel Home ; Phone: 555-123-5467; gender: male

blockquote.p: description: Low-dose xanomeline arm (50 cm2 TTS Formulation E, 54 mg xanomeline)
description: High-dose xanomeline arm (75 cm2 TTS Formulation E, 81 mg xanomeline)

name: To determine if there is a statistically significant relationship (overall Type 1 error rate, α=.05) between the change in both ADAS-Cog and CIBIC+ scores, and drug dose (0, 50 cm2 [54 mg], and 75 cm2 [81 mg]).
name: To document the safety profile of the xanomeline TTS.
name: To assess the dose-dependent improvement in behavior. Improved scores on the Revised Neuropsychiatric Inventory (NPI-X) will indicate improvement in these areas.
name: To assess the dose-dependent improvements in activities of daily living. Improved scores on the Disability Assessment for Dementia (DAD) will indicate improvement in these areas.

name: To assess the dose-dependent improvements in an extended assessment of cognition that integrates attention/concentration tasks. The Alzheimer’s Disease Assessment Scale-14 item Cognitive Subscale, hereafter referred to as ADAS-Cog (14), will be used for this assessment.
name: To assess the treatment response as a function of Apo E genotype.

title.value: Safety and Efficacy of the Xanomeline Transdermal Therapeutic System (TTS) in Patients with Mild to Moderate Alzheimer’s Disease

display.value: Effects of xanomeline, a selective muscarinic receptor agonist, on cognitive function and behavioral symptoms in Alzheimer disease

citation.value: Bodick NC, Offen WW, Levey AI, et al. Effects of xanomeline, a selective muscarinic receptor agonist, on cognitive function and behavioral symptoms in Alzheimer disease. Arch Neurol. 1997;54(4):465-473. doi:10.1001/archneur.1997.00550160091022

text.value: Selective M1 muscarinic agonists
Alzheimer Disease
Selective M1 muscarinic agonists

description.value: ## Xanomeline (LY246708) ### Protocol H2Q-MC-LZZT(c) Safety and Efficacy of the Xanomeline Transdermal Therapeutic System (TTS) in Patients with Mild to Moderate Alzheimer’s Disease
Low-dose xanomeline arm (50 cm2 TTS Formulation E, 54 mg xanomeline)
High-dose xanomeline arm (75 cm2 TTS Formulation E, 81 mg xanomeline)

name.value: To determine if there is a statistically significant relationship (overall Type 1 error rate, α=.05) between the change in both ADAS-Cog and CIBIC+ scores, and drug dose (0, 50 cm2 [54 mg], and 75 cm2 [81 mg]).
To document the safety profile of the xanomeline TTS.
To assess the dose-dependent improvement in behavior. Improved scores on the Revised Neuropsychiatric Inventory (NPI-X) will indicate improvement in these areas.
To assess the dose-dependent improvements in activities of daily living. Improved scores on the Disability Assessment for Dementia (DAD) will indicate improvement in these areas.

To assess the dose-dependent improvements in an extended assessment of cognition that integrates attention/concentration tasks. The Alzheimer’s Disease Assessment Scale-14 item Cognitive Subscale, hereafter referred to as ADAS-Cog (14), will be used for this assessment.
To assess the treatment response as a function of Apo E genotype.
